alert.note: Alert for Cassia (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 13 at 1:34PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Idaho, including the following counties, Cassia, Oneida and Power. * WHEN...Until 430 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 132 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated very heavy rain falling due to nearly stationary thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area over the next 1 to 2 hours. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Malta, Rockland, Juniper, Fort Hall Bannock Peak, Elba, Almo, Sublett Reservoir, Sweetzer Summit, Roy, Bridge, Arbon, Pauline and eastern City Of Rocks. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Find an alternate route. If you observe flooding, please report your observations to the National Weather Service in Pocatello via phone, email, or social media, as soon as it is safe to do so.
